Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk abrt
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: abrt bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The Automatic Bug Reporting Tool (ABRT) recognizes defects in applications and creates bug reports that help maintainers fix the defects. ABRT uses a plug-in system to extend its functionality. This update fixes the following bugs: Before this update, the abrt-merge-pstoreoops command merged files in ascending order in the /sys/fs/pstore/ directory, though the contents of those files were arranged in descending order. Consequently, the merged files were inconsistently ordered. This bug has now been fixed so that the files are ordered correctly when merged. (BZ#1233662) Previously, there was a bug which caused ABRT to log unnecessary and repeated information in the systemd journal. This bug has now been fixed and ABRT no longer adds this unnecessary information. (BZ#1243280) Previously, the documentation in the /etc/abrt/plugins/CCpp.conf configuration file regarding the MakeCompatCore option was incorrect. This bug has been fixed and /etc/abrt/plugins/CCpp.conf now contains an accurate explanation of the MakeCompatCore option. (BZ#1252419) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: ABRT can now be configured to generate a backtrace without writing a coredump file to the disk. This can save time when working with processes which have allocated large blocks of memory. This feature can be enabled by setting the "CreateCoreBacktrace" option to "yes" and the "SaveFullCore" option to "no" in the /etc/abrt/plugins/CCpp.conf file. (BZ#1210601) Users of abrt are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
